intro: Hieracium leiopsis, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium leiopsis is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
